intro: Lycianthes subtruncata var. remotidens, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The fruit is a small, green berry that turns red when mature, often containing several seeds.
